experiment: F-META7: Integration sessions for dark matter reduction — batch theming via dream.py
expect: dark matter drops from 23.3% (118/509 INDEX.md view) to <20% after theming ≥20 lessons
method: 1. Diagnosed dream.py theme detection failures (5 failure modes). 2. Fixed dream.py regex for bold **Domain**: X format and case-insensitive matching. 3. Batch-added Domain: fields to 38 S300+ era lessons lacking domain info.

old_dream_py_head.note: HEAD before c2df475 — no Domain field fallback

post_c2df475.note: After Domain field fallback added by concurrent session

interventions.action: Fix bold **Domain**: X format regex in dream.py
Batch Domain field addition — 19 S300+ era lessons (L-342 to L-521)
Add domain: X to 3 HTML comment lessons (L-406, L-408, L-413) + case-insensitive regex
Batch Domain field for 13 INDEX.md-referenced lessons (L-100 to L-329)

diff: Expected <20% with ≥20 lessons themed. Achieved 18.5% with 38 lessons themed. The dream.py regex fix alone recovered 24 lessons (no file edits needed). Five failure modes diagnosed: no-session-line (70), bold-no-domain (22→fixed), old-format (4), periodic-no-domain (3), session-no-domain-S300+ (23→fixed). Residual floor: ~96 lessons are very old (pre-S100) with no session header — genuine dark matter requiring content-based theming.
verdict: PARTIAL — F-META7 integration protocol validated: batch domain theming reduces dark matter from 30% to 18.5% in one session. Residual floor ~18% is genuine (pre-format-era lessons). Next: content-based theming for pre-S100 lessons; measure ISO discovery rate change.
